tags: some things make zero sense man
if my muse is not dead I'll try and write some oneshots of shit hitting the fan in boggart classes for characters from the books
summary: I’m probably not breaking ground here, but I really need to vent about something in the HP books. Lupin, hailed as a model...
body:
I’m probably not breaking ground here, but I really need to vent about something in the HP books. Lupin, hailed as a model teacher and father figure for Harry (and he mostly was indeed), brought a Boggart for his 13 year old students to fight. Like, randomly he just brought it in, gave them ten minutes to think of their ‘greatest fear’ and a way to make it funny and then off they went. I mean, imagine it’s another Tuesday, you drag yourself out of bed, thinking that ‘oh well, McGonagall might give us a pop qiuz today’ and then tada, you need to face your greatest fear! In public! Possibly in front of people who have little respect for you and might not even wish you well (cause kids are dicks like that). 

And no one finds this weird! The students are like, okay just a sec to decide between the giant cobra and the giant spider and off we go. Then CoG comes out and we learn that boggarts are part of the curriculum, not just a *really* bad idea of Lupin’s. Are you fucking kidding me? And then they act surprised that Leta’s fear is so bizarre and fucking *traumatic*! I mean, yeah, what could possibly go wrong when you ask for people’s GREATEST FEAR to be made public!

But I’m getting ahead of myself, because, first of all, how are we even sure we know what our greatest fear is? Seriously, you, dear reader, take a moment and think of your greatest fear. Do you even know what it is? And if so in what degree of certainty? How confidently would you face that boggart (alone, no gossipy eyes here) and be sure that the thing will turn into, say, your dead family? What if it turned into something else, maybe somehting you wouldn’t want to face in yourself, eg disappointing a parent? 

I’m gonna go ahead and confess that I don’t even know what my greatest fear is. But ten years ago,as a 13 year old, I’d be expected to stand in front of my class, that bullied me mercilessly, and a teacher with whom I’m supposed to have a professional relationship with, and discover some deep shit about myself? Umm, NO. Not happening, no way in hell.

summary: The life of an average wizard
title: The life of an average wizard
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2PimwTV

by Picasohasaballoon

Change a few details of the past and you have an entirely different present.
In this present Harry grows up with his parents. There is no prophecy shaped guillotine hanging over his head, no expectations and no fame, but somehow trouble still manages to find him.

Words: 3660, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Harry Potter - J. K. Rowling
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Categories: Gen, Multi
  • Characters: Harry Potter, Neville Longbottom, Draco Malfoy, Tom Riddle, basically the whole Harry Potter cast, And Then Some - Character
  • Relationships: James Potter/Lily Evans Potter, Alice Longbottom/Frank Longbottom, Harry Potter & Tom Riddle, and probably many more to come
  • Additional Tags: Smart Harry Potter, Harry Potter was raised by his parents, Sane Voldemort (Harry Potter), everyone is oc, Harry gets a happy childhood, Dubious Morality, Psychopathology & Sociopathy, because voldemort, Harry does some questionable shit in the name of magic, Self-Indulgent


read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2PimwTV

Sirius: Where’s the metal dealy you use to dig food?

Remus: Do you mean a spoon?

Sirius: Must you undermine me at every turn?
trail.content:
Sirius: Where’s the metal dealy you use to dig food?

Remus: Do you mean a spoon?

Sirius: Must you undermine me at every turn?

blog.name: stereotypicalgryffindor
blog.title: i solemnly swear i am up to no good.
blog.description: in a very short period of time.

summary: Nowhere girl - Epilogue - Snails Mail and the Owls Howl
body:
Nowhere girl - Epilogue - Snails Mail and the Owls Howl

Sorry for being away for a really long time, but i have come back !! ᕦ(ò_óˇ)ᕤ

This is a hogwarts fanfic set in the mauraders era. I will most likely be experimenting with the POV and stuff. Enjoy!

(I wrote this on my notes so sorry if the paragraphing is wierddd)

nowhere girl

epilogue: snail mail and the owls howl

Hello, my name is Y/N. I’m currently very 11.2 years old and I am probably the coolest person you’ve never met. When I was six years old I made a snail fly across the room and whack my teacher in the head, but she didn’t know that, and it was extremely hard to not try and burst out laughing. She had just called me a hyper something something and gave me a big fat D for my show and tell, even though my idea for a snails that deliver your mail was way cooler then Dereks lollipop house.

Alright, maybe it wasn’t a that, maybe it was a couple of snails that I had picked up from the playground outside because I forgot that the night was show and tell.

Anyways, other since then I could something makes things levitate or if I was super angry burst and explode; of course when I wanted to tell someone, no-one would believe me and say I was making up one of my silly stories again. I would always fly the highest on my swing and try to fly far far away, away from my stupid father and his stupid girlfriend. Cross the seas all the way to America where captain America can recruit me and I could finally have a really cool name and suit and a comic series all to myself. What would my name be? Captainess of Manchester? No, I would much like magical witch, fitting my very real and very awesome magic powers.

I was wondering all this as I’m currently in lock down from my evil dad and his ugly witch girlfriend ( bad witch, not a good one like me ) for calling her a stinky fake who can’t cook for nothing. She’s been starving me as all she knows how to cook is an undercooked pasta with a burnt sauce, and that earned me a slap from my dad. And now, here I am, hoping that something will miraculously save me from my fleeting thoughts of worry , I’m moving to secondary school. I sometimes worry that I have too many friends and many of them aren’t real, they’re there for a laugh or joke or go out to the mall but it isn’t like I can tell them what’s really going on. If I told them my dad hits me they would laugh at my face say “good one y/n!” i wonder what it would feel like to have real friends, friends on which i can count on.

Nevertheless, my thoughts get rudely interrupted by a bang from my painted window. i get up my teeny weeny bed (which is way to small for me) and look towards the window which was beautifully painted by 7 year old me. it had a bunch of pictures of marvel and dc cutouts from comics and an- owl? an owl, wha- WHAT IS AN OWL DOING AT MY WINDOW? Wait, why am i freaking out, this is really cool! I thought that owls are n-o-c-t-u-r-n-a-l. this made no sense, but since when did anything?

“hoot hoot”

“well hoot hoot to you to, kind sir”

the tawny owl cocked its head to the side, signaling to me to let it in.

“there’s no way in hell you’re coming in, what do you think your doing? dropping by my mail?”

I chuckle to myself , as that was pretty ruddy hilarious, but the owls feathers flow with the howling outside wind and i swear it nod. NOD!! I squint and realize im not wearing my hideous circular glasses, so i grab my golden specs from my broken beside table (my dad claims he’s going to fix them, but he’s been saying that for the last 7 years) and put them on. They’re pretty smudged , but i can instantly see much more, and i can see it’s claws all over a cool looking envelope. I clammer towards my window and immediately crack it open and allow for the owl to come in, but it doesn’t seem to be too interested. I thank it for its royal services - maybe it’s an owl from the queen? The letter seems to look royal , and my sweaty dirty hands from digging in the mud with my dog rip it open. As soon as it happens I can hear a knock from downstairs.

Knockity knockity knock knock-knockity

What a peculiar pattern? It can’t be someone we know. My attention flies away to this new visitor and I open the door and fly down the stairs, in likely fashion of the captainess of manchester and open the door where stood a man so old and pretty wrinkly yet he had the strangest twinkle in his eye. And he was wearing the strangest clothes! A silver suit with a purple tie and the most fantastic emerald glittering shoes. His beard was silver with strands of amber and his head was covered by a pointy hat you would see in cartoons.

“Is the house of Y/N L/N? I would like to have a chat with you and your guardians.”

My mouth goes dry as my mind wonders. I know the letter and this man are connected, i can feel it.

blog.name: temperamentalterpsichorean

24 | ♉️/♊️/♌️ | Soaper, Homesteader, and Chicken Wrangler | Married

Here is where my nerdy posts that aren't suitable for my other sites are.

summary: Rando plotbunny but when Mabel asks Ford “Are we finally of age to go to wizard school? IS THERE AN OWL IN THIS BAG???” I had...
body: Rando plotbunny but when Mabel asks Ford “Are we finally of age to go to wizard school? IS THERE AN OWL IN THIS BAG???” I had the thought that Ford would actually probably know if there’s a universe where Harry Potter exists. And now I’m imagining Ford as one of the many DADA teachers.

summary:
Draco: I hate you!
Harry: Why?
Draco: I wanted to wear your comfy sweater today, and you're wearing it
Harry: Buy one for...
body:
Draco: I hate you!
Harry: Why?
Draco: I wanted to wear your comfy sweater today, and you're wearing it
Harry: Buy one for you?
Draco: What? And that people see me buying such a horrid thing? No, thanks

summary: It’s such a weird thought to me that there’s people that‘ll look at Tony Stark/Jon Snow/Harry Potter/whoever and just see a...
body:
It’s such a weird thought to me that there’s people that‘ll look at Tony Stark/Jon Snow/Harry Potter/whoever and just see a bunch of fictional people without understanding how much they mean to so many of us.

I‘m almost a little sorry for them
